      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void btnLoadStations()
      This function is loads the cboApt ComboBox with the airport names from the stations table in the Weather.mdb database.
      void btnLoadWeather()
      This function is loads the winds aloft weather from the NWS website into a text tile using the Inet class.
      void loadAirports()
      This function is loads the airports from the winds aloft webpage and puts them in the airport combobox on the form
      void loadAltitudes()
      This function loads the 9 altitudes into the altidude combobox on the form.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeatherForm12

        public WeatherForm12()
        This function is the constructor. It creates the form and places all labels, buttons, comboboxes, and text fields on a panel and adds it to the frame. Then it sets everything to visible. The constructor also calls loadAirports() and loadAltitudes to pobulate the comboboxes
        Parameters:
        none -

    • Method Detail

      • btnLoadStations

        public void btnLoadStations()
        This function is loads the cboApt ComboBox with the airport names from the stations table in the Weather.mdb database. It creates an Inet object to download the stations.txt file form the faculty.sdmirimar.edu website and then creates a DBUpdt object to store the txt file in the database. Finally, the stationName field is extracted for every field in the database and inputed into the cboApt Combobox
        Parameters:
        none -

      • btnLoadWeather

        public void btnLoadWeather()
        This function is loads the winds aloft weather from the NWS website into a text tile using the Inet class. The text file then is read using the Inet class, and the station weather for each station is read from the file and put into the Weather.mdb database using the DBUpdt class.
        Parameters:
        none -

      • loadAltitudes

        public void loadAltitudes()
        This function loads the 9 altitudes into the altidude combobox on the form.

      • loadAirports

        public void loadAirports()
        This function is loads the airports from the winds aloft webpage and puts them in the airport combobox on the form

      • setTextFieldlarge

        public javax.swing.JTextField setTextFieldlarge(int fmLeft,
                                       int fmTop,
                                       java.lang.String strVar)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position the airport status on th eframe. It must be large enough to hold a long status
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strVar - a string object representing the contents that will be placed in the text field
        Returns:
        TextField a JTextField object that will contain weather information

      • setTextField

        public javax.swing.JTextField setTextField(int fmLeft,
                                  int fmTop,
                                  java.lang.String strVar)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position the wind direction, speed, and temperature text fields on the frame
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strVar - a string object representing the contents that will be placed in the text field
        Returns:
        TextField a JTextField object that will contain weather information

      • setLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel setLabel(int fmLeft,
                          int fmTop,
                          java.lang.String strVar)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position all the various small labels on the frame
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strVar - a string object representing the contents that will be placed in the label
        Returns:
        label a JLabel object to label the components of the frame

      • updateTextBoxes

        public void updateTextBoxes(java.lang.String strApt,
                   java.lang.String strAlt)
        This function is called whenever a combobox item is selected. It makes sure that two combobox items, station name and altitude, must be selected in order for the text fields to update with correct weather information
        Parameters:
        strApt - a string representing the name of the airport
        strAlt - a character string representing the weather altitude in thousands of feet.
